subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to comment test methods in Junit 4?
msgSnippet: ... Well Request filtered= request.filterWith(filter); seems to suggest that there is more than one way to define a Request. OK, I downloaded the javadoc (it s
messageBody:
junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> On 6/7/06, Ilja Preuss <preuss@...> wrote:
>>
>>> Right, but one Filter class can only filter one Test class since
>>> it's tied to a Request class:
>>
>> What makes you think that a Request is tied to a "Test class"???
>
> This:
>
> Request request= Request.aClass(Example.class);

Well

Request filtered= request.filterWith(filter);

seems to suggest that there is more than one way to define a Request.

OK, I downloaded the javadoc (it's not online, unfortunately?), and there is
also a method to define a Request for a set of test classes, as well as for
a single test method.

Take care, Ilja
